docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
Shift Left means taking bach-processing jobs and try to refactor them to real-time processing using a product such as Apache Flink. In batch processing a lot of projects use SQL and dbt (Data build tool) to define the logic of the data pipeline. In real-time processing, Apache Kafka is a de-facto middleware to persist immutable records, and for SQL, Python and Java based real-time processing, Apache Flink is also the preferred platform.

  • Start docker compose, the first time it may take some time.
docker compose up -d

docs.title: Pre-requisites
docs.text:
• You need git cli
  • Clone this repository: git clone https://github.com/jbcodeforce/shift_left_utils.git
  • Get docker engine and docker cli.
# docker version used
version 27.3.1, build ce12230

If for some reason, you could not use Docker Desktop, you can try Colima, Ranger Desktop, or podman.

For colima the following configuration was used: colima start -c 4 -m 32 -d 100 -r docker

docs.title: Project setup
docs.text: Modify the docker-compose to reference where the source code folder is.
